author: {'steamid': '76561199131230807', 'num_games_owned': 14, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 21162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 9, 'playtime_at_review': 20065, 'last_played': 1731741295}
review:
Picture this,

It is 7 PM on a tuesday. and you had the most stressful day of the month. You sit, log on steam, open left 4 dead two, and choose to fight a horde of teletubbies while welding not only a diamond sword, but Doomslayer's shotgun, all while playing as peter griffin, with goku, masterchief, and barney the dinosaur by your side; all while you down cheese burgers, covid shots, throwing Mario 64 toads to lure the teletubbies away, and you use a baja blast sponsored chest paddles to revive goku, all while releasing lead at the grandma from Coco.

Absolute Cinema

review:
I shot a zombie in the stomach as it was running past me. It's intestines fell out, and they trailed behind it as it stumbled for a few meters before dying.

To think how far the industry has fallen since 2009.

author: {'steamid': '76561198330990818', 'num_games_owned': 131, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 905, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 905, 'last_played': 1707039258}
review:
OVERVIEW: I started playing LFD 2 with an open mind since for a long long time I haven't been visiting FPS titles, last time I played one was probably Call of Duty World at War back in 2008'ish. Since I am eager to play a diversity of games, I thought I better have a go at this survival VALVE story


Pros
-» Gameplay: very rich, weapons feel distinct from eachother even if you consider the melee ones
-» Soundtrack and sound effects: cutting edge in both fronts
-» Graphics: for the price we are paying, absolutely wonderful
-» Replayability: Massive. Many interesting modes and still many players to co-op or play versus online
-» Difficulty: Balanced
Cons
-» This is a masterpiece if you are fairly new to this type of game....so none

SUMMARY:
9.5/10 gaming scale


Disclosure: After clearing the main campaign and, as I comeback for new sessions or new updates arise by developers, I intend to keep revising this review

author: {'steamid': '76561198389851759', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 35536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 30, 'playtime_at_review': 33730, 'last_played': 1731679873}
review:
This game just ages like a fine wine. It's also the type of game that you won't get tired or bored playing over and over again - it's just that good. As per the date/time I'm making this review, the game reaches its 15th anniversary this year 2024 and it never did lose its charm. For this game this old, you gotta give the credit to Valve for this. More importantly, L4D2 is a class of its own and to call it a masterpiece is an understatement.

I won't find myself stopping playing campaigns with my solid teammates anytime soon. So you zombies out there, you better watch out. Bullets coming your way!

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198028011423', 'num_games_owned': 18411, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 34232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34232, 'last_played': 1703375787}
review:
Left 4 Dead 2 is an absolute gem in co-op survival gaming, and it truly excels at delivering an exhilarating experience. The heart and soul of the game lie in the relentless waves of zombies that you and your team must conquer and the joy of teamwork and cooperation that come along with it. The gameplay is nothing short of fantastic, allowing you to focus on the thrill of slaying endless hordes of undead without being burdened by complex mechanics. As a sequel to the beloved original Left 4 Dead, this game lives up to the expectations set by its predecessor. It comes packed with almost everything that made the first game great, and to sweeten the deal, it even includes the original campaigns. However, it's worth noting that while the core gameplay remains exceptional, some players may need to have the ambiance and darker tone of the first installment. Exploring both games provides a richer experience, showcasing the series' evolution. Though Left 4 Dead 2 has a story, it takes a backseat to the heart-pounding co-op gameplay. Let's be honest; the true joy comes from joining forces with friends to survive the relentless onslaught of infection. The camaraderie and excitement of cooperative play overshadow the narrative, but that's precisely what makes Left 4 Dead 2 so addictively fun. This addition is crucial for an unfiltered and unrestricted gaming experience, giving you the freedom to fully enjoy the game.

In conclusion, Left 4 Dead 2 is a masterpiece in co-op survival gaming that captivates players with its action-packed and immersive gameplay. Whether you're a seasoned fan of the series or new to the zombie apocalypse genre, this game is an absolute must-play. Gather your squad, gear up, and brace yourselves for an unforgettable adventure through the zombie-infested world. The thrills and cooperative joy will keep you hooked for hours on end. Hopefully, we will live to see Valve create a sequel with number 3 in it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198432882648', 'num_games_owned': 301, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1725148876}

author: {'steamid': '76561198271372510', 'num_games_owned': 206, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 3577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3577, 'last_played': 1708572704}
review: Easily one of the must buys on steam to play with friends, even just solo. With all of the content from L4D1 included, and insane modding potential, this is one of the best multiplayer shooters one could ever play. Nothing since has recaptured this lightning in a bottle, and people tried. They failed, pretty badly at that (Looking at you, Back 4 Blood!).

author: {'steamid': '76561198085390887', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 4695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 15, 'playtime_at_review': 4695, 'last_played': 1732762187}
review: First game I ever played, still as good and super fun. Always better than b4b!

author: {'steamid': '76561198142993008', 'num_games_owned': 1540, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 3114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3114, 'last_played': 1726573107}
review:
Left 4 Dead 2 remains as an iconic horde shooter even after all these years. Its fast-paced gameplay and cooperative mechanics make surviving against relentless waves of zombies both thrilling and strategic. The dynamic AI director ensures no two playthroughs are the same, keeping the game fresh and exciting.

One of the standout features is the Steam Workshop integration, allowing for endless customization. From new maps to character skins, you can even transform your survivors into ANIME GIRLS!

While the core gameplay is timeless, the community-driven mods give Left 4 Dead 2 near-infinite replayability. Simply put, it's a must-play for any co-op shooter fan.
